And how that's not the best thing to do. To date men like that and validate thinking like that. I thought that was a fair point to make, in fact that's kinda at the core of the incel ethic. But somehow that's too controversial a viewpoint to preach. &#x200B; And that's why we're angry. Because we're saying "We thought being a womanizing jerk was bad and that people who support that shouldn't do that!" And in response, the world says "Shut up incel, you're just entitled." We're confused at a world that, at face value, claims to be about the content of your character, where all you have to do is be yourself and be decent and the right people will gravitate towards you, but any time we point out a jerk who gets ahead, we're accused of being the jerks and that the jerks we've fingered have done nothing wrong.
